 2. The status of the authority's activities and outcomes related to
section eighteen hundred ninety-four of this title. Such report shall
include, but not be limited to:
contracts entered into pursuant to\nsection eighteen hundred ninety-four of this title;
the geographical\narea or areas served by each entity;
the amount of the grants\ndisbursed to each entity;

 3. The status of the authority's activities and outcomes related to
section eighteen hundred ninety-six of this title. Such report shall
include, but not be limited to:
the number of persons who have applied for and received financial\nassistance through the revolving loan fund;\n
the revolving loan fund account balances;\n
the number of loans in default;\n
the amount and nature of the costs incurred by the authority for\nthe activities described in paragraph
of subdivision one of section\neighteen hundred ninety-six of this title;\n

the authority's activities and outcomes related to establishing an
on-bill recovery mechanism, including the number of persons who have
applied for and who have received financial assistance that utilizes
on-bill recovery and the results of the evaluation program performed
pursuant to subdivision three of section eighteen hundred ninety-six of
this title;
the amount expended by the authority in support of the program and\nthe purposes for which such funds have been expended;\n
the number of program participants who are in arrears in their\nutility accounts for electric and/or gas service;\n
the number of program participants who are in arrears in their\non-bill recovery charge payments;\n
the number of program participants whose utility service has been\nterminated for non-payment;\n
a description of the geographic distribution of loans made;\n
an estimate of the energy savings resulting from this program;\n
an estimate of the average project cost; and\n

in consultation with the department of labor, an estimate of the
number of jobs created under the program.
 4. The status of the authority's activities and outcomes related to

the number of individuals receiving\ntraining services;

the amount of funds awarded to each such organization; and\n

the number of individuals placed in full-time employment; and
